title: Education Credential Type Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for types of credentials awarded in education and training contexts.

terms.label: Degree
terms.definition: A formal academic degree credential such as associate, bachelor, master, or doctoral degree awarded by an authorized institution.

terms.label: Certificate
terms.definition: A credential recognizing completion of a program of study or training that does not meet the definition of a degree credential.

terms.label: Diploma
terms.definition: A credential commonly associated with completion of secondary education or specific postsecondary programs, as defined in the source system.

terms.label: Microcredential
terms.definition: A shorter, focused credential such as a microcredential, nanodegree, or digital badge recognizing specific skills or competencies.

terms.label: License
terms.definition: A credential issued by a licensing authority granting legal permission to practice in a regulated profession or role.

terms.label: Certification
terms.definition: A credential indicating that an individual has met defined standards of knowledge or skill, often awarded by a professional or industry body.

terms.label: Other Credential Type
terms.definition: A credential type that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary but is needed to represent source systems or external frameworks.
